maml:description.maml:para: Remove Account Operators built-in group from the given object
Remove the built-in group Account Operators from the given object.
Distinguished Name of the object (or container) where the permissions are going to be removed.
Distinguished Name of the object (or container) where the permissions are going to be removed.
STRING representing the Distinguished Name of the object (ej. OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).

for the given object

The SamAccountName of object to search for within all Access Rules.

The function will Set/Clear Inheritance of an object
The function will Set/Clear Inheritance of an object.
RemoveInheritancevalue will Set/Remove the inheritance Check-Box
* If TRUE the value of the IsProtected parameter (1) to TRUE, the inheritance checkbox will be cleared.
* If FALSE, the checkbox will become checked

RemovePermissions will "copy" (true) or "remove" (false) the permissions. The "preserveInheritance" parameter (2) only has an effect when we uncheck the inheritance checkbox (RemoveInheritancevalue = TRUE).
* If RemovePermissions is set to TRUE then the permissions from the parent object are copied to the object. It has the same effect as clicking "Add".
* If RemovePermissions is set to FALSE, it has the same effect as clicking "Remove"
Distinguished Name of the object (or container) where the permissions are going to be configured.
TRUE or FALSE for the IsProtected parameter. If TRUE the inheritance will be cleared.
TRUE or FALSE for the preserveInheritance parameter. If TRUE the permissions from the parent object are copied to the object, otherwise are removed.
Distinguished Name of the object (or container) where the permissions are going to be configured.
TRUE or FALSE for the IsProtected parameter. If TRUE the inheritance will be cleared.
TRUE or FALSE for the preserveInheritance parameter. If TRUE the permissions from the parent object are copied to the object, otherwise are removed.
STRING representing the Distinguished Name of the object (ej. OU=Users,OU=Good,OU=Sites,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).

Set the restrictions on Local groups (MUST be executed on DomainController)
Add groups to the restricted group section of a GPO.
Name of the GPO which will get the Restricted Groups modification.
Switch indicator to merge users (retain existing users). Default is not present, meaning all users in group will be removed
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Administrators group.
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Backup Operator group.
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Event Log Readers group.
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Performance Log Users group.
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Performance Monitor Users group.
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Remote Desktop Users group.
Name of the GPO which will get the Restricted Groups modification.
Switch indicator to merge users (retain existing users). Default is not present, meaning all users in group will be removed
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Administrators group.
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Backup Operator group.
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Event Log Readers group.
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Performance Log Users group.
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Performance Monitor Users group.
Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Remote Desktop Users group.
STRING Name of the GPO which will get the Restricted Groups modification.
SWITCH parameter (true or false).
If present the value becomes TRUE, and the existing group members will remain. New users will be added.
Default is Not Present, so value becomes FALSE, and the existing group members will be removed, having only the users configured by this CMDlet.
STRING[] Identity (SamAccountName) to be included in the Local Administrators group."

Remove Un-Resolvable SID from a given object
Remove Un-Resolvable SID from a given object. If a SID is displayed within the ACE, is
because a name could not be resolved. Most likely the object was deleted, and its friendly
name could not be retrived. This function will identify this unresolved SID and remove it from the ACE
Distinguished Name of the object (or container) where the permissions are going to be configured.
Switch indicator to remove the unknown SID
Distinguished Name of the object (or container) where the permissions are going to be configured.
Switch indicator to remove the unknown SID
STRING representing the Distinguished Name of the object (ej. OU=Users,OU=Good,OU=Sites,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).
SWITCH parameter (true or false). If present the value becomes TRUE, and the unknown SID will be removed. If ommited, unknown SID will only display.
